body_content.explanation: a small piece of paper or card given to someone, usually to show that they have paid for an event, journey, or activity:
a piece of card or paper that is put on an object to show its size or price:
a note telling you that you must pay some money as a punishment for not obeying a rule or law:
a list of the people representing a particular political party in an election:
examples: In this election there will definitely be a woman on the Democratic ticket.
Bush and Cheney won re-election in 2004 against a Democratic ticket of John Kerry and John Edwards.

body_content.explanation: the policies that are supported by a political party or a person competing in an election:
examples: The President was elected on a ticket of restoring the rule of law.
Twice he stood for parliament on an educational reform ticket.

body_content.explanation: a request sent online or by phone for help with a problem with a website, computer system, etc.:
examples: If you still need assistance after reading the information in this section, simply raise a ticket in the CONTACT US section of the website.
Two weeks ago I put in a ticket asking if I could change my caller ID.
They are pretty good about replying to you if you have emailed them and/or opened a ticket.

body_content.explanation: to sell tickets for an event; to provide someone with a ticket:
examples: Only passengers who were ticketed on that particular flight will receive a refund.

body_content.explanation: to give a ticket to someone who has broken a traffic law:
